unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Insurance Premiums
question_text:
A company with $500\text{ employees}$ wants to have its group health insurance premiums lowered.
The Human Resources (HR) team sent out a questionnaire to every employee, which everyone filled out and returned. One question appears below:
What have you done in the past year to improve your health? (Circle all that apply.)
A. I have eaten healthier. B. I have exercised regularly.
When the results were tabulated, the HR clerk found that $140\text{ people}$ circled response A, $290\text{ people}$ circled response B, and $50\text{ people}$ circled both responses A and B.
What percent of company employees circled neither A nor B?
